  • Speakers
  • Posters

  • Subjects

2018

Conference Proceedings

Portrait of the Galaxy as a Young Galaxy by Alex Gurvich, Department of Physics & Astronomy

Themes

computational simulations, large data sets, machine learning, and visualization

Browse

Presentation Abstracts

Keynote addresses from Victoria Stodden, Associate Professor of Information Sciences, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign & Shane Larson, Associate Director of CIERA (Center for Interdisciplinary Exploration and Research in Astrophysics at Northwestern University. Morning and afternoon sessions featuring Northwestern faculty and graduate students.

Posters

Selected poster presentations highlighting Northwestern student and postdoctoral research are available and archived by the library.

Visualizations

Selected visualizations created by Northwestern students and postdoctoral researchers are presented as images, videos, and interactive graphics.

About

Computational Research Day is hosted by Northwestern IT Research Computing and sponsored by Weinberg College of Arts and Sciences, McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science, Kellogg School of Management, Feinberg School of Medicine, Office for Research, The Graduate School, Northwestern University Libraries, CIERA (Center for Interdisciplinary Exploration and Research in Astrophysics), NICO (Northwestern Institute on Complex Systems), Hewlett Packard Enterprise, and the PIER Group.

Computational Research Day is organized by Northwestern IT Research Computing of Northwestern University. The proceedings are published with support from Digital Scholarship Services of Northwestern University Libraries.
